summary: Clear cell sarcoma is a rare sub-type of sarcoma that mainly occurs in soft tissues and the dermis. It presents as a slow-growing mass, often affecting tendons and aponeuroses, and is typically found in the extremities, particularly around the knee, feet, and ankle. Patients are usually between 20 and 40 years old. Recurrence is common, and metastasis can occur in over 50% of cases.
subtypes: Clear cell sarcoma of the soft tissues
Clear cell sarcoma of the kidney
